alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 10:34AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1033 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pearl River, or near Slidell, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River, Pearlington and Stennis Space Center. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 265 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 12 near mile marker 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
